alert.note: Alert for Caguas; Gurabo; San Lorenzo (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 06 at 7:58PM AST until February 06 at 9:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AST THIS EVENING FOR CAGUAS, GURABO AND SAN LORENZO... At 758 PM AST, USGS river sensors along Rio Grande de Loiza indicate stream flow at or near flood stage at various locations upstream across Caguas, Gurabo and San Lorenzo. Additional rainfall amounts up to one inch are possible within the next hours. Therefore, the Flash Flood Warning will remain in place for these areas. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. For RIO GRANDE DE LOIZA at Rio Grande de Loiza at Caguas: At 7:30pm the stage was 13.77 feet. Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
